item.title: Great Top-Down Shooter Games On Steam That Deserve More Attention
item.description:
Summary

  • Top-down shooters provide a wider view of action, offering a preferable display for players seeking flashy violence.
  • Fans of shooters can find hidden gems in lesser-known top-down shooters with unique gameplay loops and intense combat.
  • Indie top-down shooters like Neon Chrome, Synthetik 2, and Brigador offer intense, action-packed gameplay experiences worth exploring.

The issue with first-person shooters is that players can't see all that juicy action with a limited field of view. That's a shortcoming that top-down shooters don't have. For some players, the latter might offer a more preferable display of all the flashy violence. A quick glance at games like Enter the Gungeon , The Ascent , or Hotline Miami proves this point well enough. But as popular as those titles are, some top-down shooters don't exactly get the recognition that they deserve. Some of them are due to being indie titles, while other cases boil down to player preference. Still, that doesn't mean these following shooters offer a lesser experience.

Fans of shooter games ought to broaden their perspective by playing lesser-known top-down shooters . After all, there are so many games on Steam that some of them are bound to slip under the cracks. Players who decide to try out games that don't have the biggest following but showcase a lot of heart will be more than pleased by what's on offer in certain games that make the most of a top-down perspective. More often than not, the action in these games is in a class of its own and does a great job of letting players come to grips with the combat in their games before letting loose in the most action-packed manner possible.

Updated January 15, 2025, by Mehrdad Khayyat: Top-down shooter is one of those genres in gaming that indie developers love to work on. There are a couple of reasons for that, but it's usually because of the fact that it doesn't require realistic visuals, and gameplay mechanics are quite simple.

Thankfully, there is a plethora of choices for fans of top-down shooters, even for those who prefer the game to feature top-notch visuals. This amazing variety in a single genre, however, makes it difficult to pick up the best experiences.

27 Thunder Tier One

Steam Reviews: 66% Positive

  • Developer: Krafton
  • Release Date: December 7, 2021
  • Platform: PC

Don't judge this game by its Steam reviews! A significant number of the reviews just point out the game's empty servers and the dead PvP community, but it is still a lot of fun to play solo or with friends as a co-op experience.

Thunder Tier One is a tactical military shooter with realistic visuals. The game features a 9-mission story-driven campaign that takes place in a variety of locations. Before the mission, players get to choose the weapons and equipment required for the mission.

The gameplay provides a sandbox experience, where the player can decide how to approach the situation and accomplish the objective. Using drones and cutting-edge tech is also a fun part of Thunder Tier One 's gameplay.

26 The Ascent

Steam Reviews: 75% Positive

At launch, The Ascent sealed with some serious technical problems, but later updates gradually fixed the game and made it a solid experience. As a top-down shooter set in a cyberpunk world, players are in for an adventure with eye-catching visuals.

The story doesn't play a big role in The Ascent , but the gunplay is quite fun. Players can upgrade their weapons as they make progress or search hidden corners of the city to find new guns. The boss battles are challenging overall, and the game has a dark tone. The good news is that The Ascent supports both online and local co-op.

25 Wizard With A Gun

Steam Reviews: 81% Positive

Lots of players love it when their top-down shooters have other gameplay loops working in tandem. Such players will love what Wizard with a Gun brings to the table. Each run strengthens players as they gather the resources needed to upgrade their wizard tower. With these elements of survival and base-building gameplay, it's easy to see why players would find this game riveting.

Wizard with a Gun is a great title that deserves all the love it is getting, but it also deserves way more. Players can upgrade their meager pistols and use magic bullets with various spell effects to make combat easier. Each level is procedurally generated and unpredictable. Players who want to check out a unique top-down shooter will love what Wizard with a Gun offers.

24 Cluckmech Oasis

Steam Reviews: 88% Positive

  • Developer: BlackLight
  • Release Date: May 9, 2024
  • Platform: PC

With elements of tower defense gameplay to make the top-down shooting feel more methodical and strategic, it's easy to see why Cluckmech Oasis deserves more love. The game features multiple characters with unique powers and weaknesses to help them stand out as players embark on an adventure across multiple maps and levels to obtain unique machinery and save the world.

The game is as simple as can be, and the shooting gameplay feels tight and engaging. Players must adapt to the scenario in each level and enhance their firepower to show enemies who's boss. It's a fun title that fans of unique top-down shooting games will have a great time with.

23 Maniac

Steam Reviews: 92% Positive

  • Developer: Transhuman Design
  • Release Date: March 28, 2024
  • Platform: PC

Players who just want to wreak havoc in an open world where everyone is a potential victim will love what Maniac has to offer. Fans of Vampire Survivors will find this title to be right up their alley. Players unlock new characters as they progress, to cause a ton of mayhem and attract security forces who will try and stop this rampage before it gets completely out of control.

Despite how cartoonish the visuals may seem, there's no denying that the levels of violence in Maniac can become downright unbearable at times. Players who don't mind laying waste to hundreds and pushing their limits with each run will love this title. The cathartic violence becomes more ridiculous as players make slow and steady progress in the title with each run.

22 Halo: Spartan Strike

Steam Reviews: 80% Positive

There was a time when Halo could give Call of Duty a run for its money as a dominant FPS series. While the allure of this series has waned over time, there are people who still put a lot of faith in the franchise despite its hit-or-miss history.

Still, this loss of mainstream appeal means that some Halo spinoffs won't get the love they deserve, and Halo: Spartan Strike is a great example of the same. The game's stages are well-constructed and the shooting is satisfying, even if the game itself doesn't really try to attempt anything all that innovative.

21 Synthetik 2

Steam Reviews: 85% Positive

  • Developer: Flow Fire Games
  • Release Date: November 11, 2021 (Early Access)
  • Platform: PC

Synthetik is a game that developed a small and loyal fanbase, loving its action-packed shooting and how people who struggled early on in the game managed to boss their opponents after a few hours of practice. So, it was only a matter of time before the developers would attempt to develop a sequel to this wonderful game.

While Synthetik 2 is still in Early Access, the promise shown in this build has left many fans salivating for more. Hopefully, this sequel lives up to the hype and serves as an excellent improvement over its predecessor. The intense tactical gameplay is better than ever and will allow players to enjoy some amazing top-down shooting gameplay unlike anything else that the genre has to offer.

20 Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor

Steam Reviews: 86% Positive

An amazing spin-off from a goated shooter! Deep Rock Galactic: Survivor is an auto-shooter, which means the player is in charge of aiming and choosing the path, but it is such a challenging experience with an utterly enjoyable gameplay loop.

Making progress with each character class opens up more equipment and upgrade opportunities for it, which helps players reach deeper dungeons on the next try. It's a roguelike game, so there is no going back when the player dies. However, each death means the player will come back stronger with better gear. Think of it as a 3D version of Vampire Survivors.

Survivor is still in development and the developers have added multiple new biomes since its release.

19 Otxo

Steam Reviews: 94% Positive

Fans of Hotline Miami will absolutely love what Otxo brings to the table. The monochromatic art style makes the game's violence more eye-popping than ever, and players will really have to think about their loadout before embarking on one of the many runs that this roguelike will entice them with. It can seem somewhat unfair to try and beat this game at times, especially with its many challenging boss fights, but Otxo excels in making players feel like they're getting better at the game with each successive run.

The very act of reloading itself becomes something that players can spend hours pondering over, trying to make this break in their shooting as beneficial as possible. It's just one of the many small ways that Otxo immerses the player, giving them an intense sense of satisfaction when a boss that felt hard as nails early on turns into a laughing stock in no time flat.

18 Wizard Of Legend

Steam Reviews: 91% Positive

The arcade combat of Wizard of Legend is a blast, with players using a variety of spells to rain down a ton of pain on their enemies. The music is also great and something that players will love in this intense roguelike title that is most certainly one of Steam's most underappreciated indie gems.

If there's one thing that Wizard of Legend can be criticized for, it's the lack of content. Just when things get good, players will have experienced everything the game has to offer, which is a downright shame.

17 Tiny Rogues

Steam Reviews: 96% Positive

Early Access can be both a boon and a curse, with developers using this medium to fund the development of their titles while players get to enjoy a taste of a video game that can potentially leave them salivating for more. While there are instances when the promises of Early Access don't bear any fruit, many titles have managed to use Early Access to elevate the quality of their titles, and Tiny Rogues seems to be a great example of the latter scenario.

This bullet-hell roguelike can be pretty overwhelming early on, but it won't take long for players to get into the groove of things. The game already has a wealth of content, with its selection of weapons being massive, so it's easy to see why many fans can't wait for a proper 1.0 release to wow them!

16 Westerado: Double Barreled

Steam Reviews: 92% Positive

An open-world western top-down shooter with a classic revenge plot and procedurally-generated elements, Westerado: Double Barreled is one of the most underrated indie games of all time. Not many people have heard of this title, which is a shame since it brings a lot of innovative elements to the forefront and makes for an open-world title that is genuinely replayable.

The amount of urgency players have in the main story is pretty incredible, with the identity of the killer who burned down the player's ranch and murdered their family changing with each playthrough. Players can ideally kill anyone and everyone they want in the game, which is truly remarkable in its own way.

15 Grand Theft Auto 2

Steam Reviews: 88% Positive

Before the series adopted the over-the-shoulder perspective and shifted to 3D, the Grand Theft Auto series was more arcade-y in nature. The games featured a top-down perspective where players had to accomplish a bunch of missions and rack up the highest scores possible as they caused mayhem and destruction in these worlds.

Grand Theft Auto 2 is a blast to play through, and exploring this game's version of London is pretty fun in its own right. The gameplay may be slightly dated but gets the job done, and players will love checking out the history of what is now the most popular open-world franchises of all time! Fans can't wait for the sixth title to come out, and they can definitely satiate themselves for the time being by playing this game instead.

14 Neon Chrome

Steam Reviews: 93% Positive

If players want to try out a game where weapons feel extremely powerful and upgrades improve one's effectiveness in meaningful ways, then Neon Chrome is the way to go. This roguelite title is absolutely oozing in style, with the neon cyberpunk aesthetic being a blast to look at in every way. The striking art design of this game is more than enough to convince most people to check this game out for themselves!

The sheer amount of destruction that players can inflict on their enemies is truly amazing and does a great job of showing just how visceral the combat of this game is. It's impossible for players to not be satisfied while playing this game, especially with their expanded weaponry. If players need another reason to check out this shooter, then players will be elated by the fact that Neon Chrome supports co-op gameplay as well!

13 Nuclear Throne

Steam Reviews: 96% Positive

Nuclear Throne is a post-apocalypse game that takes place in the aftermath of a nuclear winter. It does break away from the cliche by disregarding the notion of humanity saving the world from its mistakes. Instead, this game is about mutants who will be doing the saving.

This allows for even more freedom since mutants can simply collect radiation and mutate into something more powerful. Along the way, they get to test out a plethora of guns in this frenetic and high-octane bullet-hell shooter. If that doesn't sound good enough, then the music during the shootouts surely will.

12 Brotato

Steam Reviews: 96% Positive

Brotato is one of the highest-rated games on Steam, which is proof enough of just how great this title really is. It was in early access for a year before seeing a full release recently.

The premise is simple enough—players control Brotato, an upstanding citizen of Potato World. But his spaceship crashed on an alien planet, and they're not fond of French fries. So Brotato must survive by shooting waves and waves of aliens.

11 Red Hot Vengeance

Steam Reviews: 96% Positive

Ever wanted to see the unholy lovechild of Superhot and Hotline Miami ? That would be Red Hot Vengeance . It's a game with a stickman art style and visuals, and the only other color apart from black and white is red— hopefully, because of the blood of all the enemies.

In this game, players are vengeance made manifest as a betrayed hitman as they take on a violent gang by being more violent. It's one of the smoothest gun carnage experiences in a top-down shooter, courtesy of the light graphics. After the story, there's still plenty of fun to be had since the game has a level editor, and it's also free.

10 Snake Force

Steam Reviews: 97% Positive

Snake Force offers something more unique compared to other formulae. It's an amalgam of a top-down shooter , FPS, and the game Snake from those old Nokia cellphones (ask some millennial grandpas about it, they know it). Players will start as a lone gunman in FPS view.

Once they have secured and rescued their soldier bros, it's time to bring out the gun-toting snake in a top-down view. Such a novel idea deserves to be experienced and seen first-hand, as words do it no justice. In any case, it's a fun game with a cute aesthetic and awesome execution.

9 Akane

Steam Reviews: 95% Positive

It's easy to see where the inspiration from Akane came from. It's a Cyberpunk action game that took a healthy serving of inspiration from genre staples such as Ghost in the Shell and Akira. The music and the cityscape alone are enough to attract anyone looking for a definitive cyberpunk game.

Players take control of the titular character in a Kill Bill -esque plot as they fight their way out of Mega-Tokyo against cyber-Yakuza using the coolest weapons known to mankind (like the katana). There's no shortage of blood, death, and neon lights here.

8 Synthetik: Legion Rising

Steam Reviews: 94% Positive

Don't be fooled by the 16-bit visual style. Synthetik is a shooter game so loud and bombastic that the gunfire is almost palpable. The audio, the animations, and the general gameplay all work together here to offer one of the most intense shooter highs that even FPS games can't reach. The game is also a roguelike, so be prepared for that.

There's not much of a story here, like with most top-down shooters. Players are merely dumped into dangerous sci-fi military facilities where they must shoot their way to their goal, which is to free the world from the Machine Legion and their gods. It's a pretty good excuse to start shooting up objects and feature the game's primary strength.

item.title: Call Of Duty: 12 Best Multiplayer Small Maps
item.description:
Summary

  • Crash in Call of Duty 4 offers a fast-paced experience with multiple playstyles and vantage points.
  • Combine in Black Ops 3 promotes constant movement with varied cover options for adrenaline-filled matches.
  • Subsonic in Black Ops 6 is fun and dynamic but requires team coordination for strategic gameplay and replayability.

The Call of Duty franchise boasts an extensive catalog of maps across all its titles. For players seeking fast-paced action packed with killstreaks and intense combat, small maps are often the top choice. These maps emphasize close-quarters encounters and quick engagements, making them popular among fans who enjoy an adrenaline-fueled experience.

Choosing the best small maps from the series isn’t easy, as there are countless options to consider. A great small map balances several factors, such as its layout, the pace it promotes, ease of movement, and replayability. While aesthetic themes and settings add to the overall appeal, the map’s ability to consistently deliver fun and competitive gameplay is crucial.

12 Crash (Call of Duty 4)

Move Constantly and Be Careful of Snipers

  • Appears in: Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare , Modern Warfare 2 (2009), Modern Warfare Remastered (2017), Call of Duty: Mobile , Modern Warfare (2019), and Warzone Mobile.

Call of Duty 4 delivers a distinct multiplayer experience, characterized by fixed character movement. Despite these limitations, Crash emerges as a standout map, offering relentless action and excitement. The map caters to various playstyles with its diverse zones, all interconnected by a central area that punishes players who linger or lose focus. Multi-leveled buildings provide numerous vantage points for snipers and tacticians, while the well-designed layout allows for quick access to respawn areas.

11 Combine (Black Ops 3)

Compact Map With Tons Of Movement And Action

  • Appears in: Black Ops 3 and Call of Duty: Mobile.

One of the standout small maps in Black Ops 3 , Combine offers an action-packed experience, marked by its vibrant colors and easy access points, especially given the jetpacks which encourage continuous movement. This map is built with three defined lanes, allowing for quick cover transitions across its short distance keeping the gameplay engaging. No matter the playstyle, the map supports a high-energy rhythm perfect for adrenaline-filled matches.

10 Subsonic (Black Ops 6)

Fun But Highly Dependent On Team Coordination

  • Appears in: Black Ops 6.

BO6 's Subsonic can be a challenging map to master, but once players familiarize themselves with its layout and understand potential enemy spawn points, they take full advantage of it. Its straightforward design provides ample opportunities for both long-range engagements on the exterior and relentless close-quarters combat in the compact center of the map, catering to a wide range of playstyles.

9 Killhouse (Call of Duty 4)

Small Shooting Range Turned Into Constant Action

  • Appears in: Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare , Call of Duty: Mobile , Modern Warfare Remastered (2017), and Modern Warfare (2019).

Killhouse delivers a fast-paced experience as its tight design features scattered structures that provide just enough cover for those quick and strategic enough to take advantage of them. Success on this map often hinges on securing control of respawn points, making team coordination key. While Call of Duty 4 ’s movement mechanics may not be as refined as more recent titles, by combining swift movement with tactical positioning, players can fully immerse themselves in the chaos.

8 Pit (Black Ops 6)

Deadly Mine Where Distractions Can Be Fatal

  • Appears in: Black Ops 6.

When it comes to sheer chaos, Pit stands as the ultimate example. This map is extremely compact, particularly given it’s part of BO6 ’s Strike mode, which leaves little room for avoiding enemies. The best approach is to stay alert and maintain constant movement on the lower level or strategically control enemy movements from the map's two elevated positions.

For those who thrive on getting a lot of kills without much resistance, the layout of Pit offers endless opportunities to ambush enemies. The dimly lit mine setting adds a unique strategic challenge, as sharp vision is essential to spot opponents caught off-guard by the mode’s relentless pace and quick transitions.

7 Shoot House (Modern Warfare 2019)

Be Aware Of All Your Surroundings

  • Appears in: Modern Warfare (2019), Call of Duty: Mobile , Modern Warfare 2 (2022), Modern Warfare 3 (2023), and Warzone Mobile.

Shoot House keeps the intensity high, ensuring non-stop action if players are in the respawn zones or battling it out in the central hub. Its open layout with minimal cover provides clear sightlines, making it easier to spot enemies almost anywhere on the map. Despite this openness, scattered objects throughout the area offer strategic cover, giving players a chance to maintain killstreaks. Staying vigilant is crucial, as opponents can exploit hidden rapid corners or less obvious elevated routes.

6 Babylon (Black Ops 6)

The Desert Of Death

  • Appears in: Black Ops 6.

Black Ops 6 's Babylon is a map with a layout reminiscent of Shipment from CoD 4 due to its square-based design. The central area of the map is critical; if players fail to control it, they may quickly fall into frustration. Mastering control of the spawn points located in its corners creates ample opportunities to accumulate high kill counts by maintaining an advantageous position. Additionally, given the lack of cover and the open nature of the map, scorestreaks, especially attack streaks, can be highly effective for clearing all areas.

5 Das Haus (Vanguard)

Simple But Effective Map For Having Fun

  • Appears in: Vanguard and Modern Warfare 3 (2023).

Das Haus offers dynamic gameplay, featuring three main access routes with clear sightlines to each spawn point. The map caters to those who enjoy aggressive playstyles, such as controlling them and keeping the pressure on. However, it’s also suited for front-line players who prefer to keep a low profile and avoid danger when needed. Wherever players spawn in Das Haus, they’ll find enemies to outmaneuver – they can either attack to dominate the kill count or defend themselves from unexpected threats.

4 Nuketown (Black Ops)

Iconic Layout Filled With Action

  • Appears in: Black Ops , Black Ops 2 , Black Ops 3 , Black Ops 4 , Black Ops Cold War , Call of Duty: Mobile , Black Ops 6 , and Black Ops: Declassified.

Nuketown earns its place in the small map category due to its intense gameplay and remarkable replay value. This iconic map, a mainstay in the Black Ops series, has seen various versions across multiple titles, yet its fundamental layout remains consistent, offering players the perfect arena for high-intensity matches. The three-lane design is a standout feature, providing players with clear routes for attack and defense, allowing rushing through the center or utilizing the elevated positions atop the houses to control the flow of the game.

3 Rust (Modern Warfare 2)

Scarce Covers Mean Constant Engagements

  • Appears in: Modern Warfare 2 (2009), Modern Warfare (2019), Warzone Mobile , Call of Duty: Mobile , and Modern Warfare 3 (2023).

Rust holds a compact design that ensures that no matter where players are, there’s no escaping their opponents. Legendary due to the “1v1” meme as the go-to battleground for settling any dispute, the map’s central oil rig provides a key advantage for those who reach the top, offering a clear line of sight, including enemy respawns.

From this vantage point, players can control everything, especially given the lack of cover. However, they must stay alert for incoming enemies looking for revenge.

2 Stakeout (Black Ops 6)

Fighting In An Apartment Never Felt So Good

  • Appears in: Black Ops 6.

If fans are after a small map where the action is fast, the pace is relentless, and distractions can easily lead to elimination, Stakeout is the perfect choice. This Black Ops 6 Strike mode map offers an intense experience with no scorestreaks to fall back on – it’s all about using the best weapons and mastering the surroundings. Set in the confined space of an apartment, its small size creates an up-close battle, with limited opportunities to catch breath during the match.

1 Shipment (Call of Duty 4)

Most Iconic Small Map Of The Franchise

  • Appears in: Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare , Ghosts , WWII , Modern Warfare Remastered (2017), Modern Warfare (2019), Call of Duty: Mobile , Vanguard , and Modern Warfare 3 (2023).

Shipment is one of the most iconic maps in the Call of Duty franchise, renowned for its chaotic, high-kill gameplay. Its tight, square layout ensures there is never a dull moment, with non-stop action that keeps players on their toes throughout the match. This map has earned its place as a go-to place to unlock weapon camos, allowing players to complete challenges more easily.

Players should avoid standing still, particularly after respawning in one of the map’s corners, to keep the momentum going, allowing them to dominate the match and maintain control.

item.title: Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp Complete - How Does Gulliver’s Cargo Ship Work?
item.description:
Quick Links

  • What Is Gulliver's Ship & How Do You Use It?
  • All Special Islands In Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp Complete
  • All Normal Islands In Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp Complete
  • All Isle Of Style Islands In Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp Complete

Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp Complete is the perfect mobile version of the basic Animal Crossing experience that players get to enjoy from the comfort of their phone screens. However, the game is a bit different from what some might be used to, having different locations and tasks that players can use to their benefit for rewards and cool items.

Using Gulliver's Ship, players can receive a lot of different items that they wouldn't always be able to get in other places. This can include insects, fish, fruit, and all kinds of other cargo as well. Here's a rundown on what you need to know about Gulliver's Ship in Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp Complete .

What Is Gulliver's Ship & How Do You Use It?

Gulliver's ship allows players to export their own items to different islands, which will then be exchanged for souvenir. These islands will all provide specific items for whichever is selected. Once a player has gotten all the souvenirs from one island, said island will then be marked as completed, the player will get a bonus reward, and then they can work on other islands.

It is important to also note that players can send the ship to multiple different islands at once.

Packages and crates are cargo, and they are made only for Gulliver's Ship. Players won't be able to place these items anywhere else but within the ship. Players can craft these by heading over to furniture and then cargo. Here, they will be given export points by loading items onto Gulliver's Ship.

It is important to know that each item is worth a certain number of points, so players will need to be sure that they keep track if they want to hit a certain number. Whatever number of points there are will not change however many hours it takes for the ship to return or the amount of items that the ship will contain.

Players can check what items they might receive from Gulliver's Ship by tapping on the Island Souvenirs that can be found on each island. Each island has different items and can also take more time than others. Each island also has different villagers on them. Upon completing a Souvenir island, players will be rewarded with Leaf Tickets , which are important to getting cool items within the game.

Something else players may want to know is if it is possible to refresh islands, as they don't refresh automatically within Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp Complete . After two days have passed from the last time the player had refreshed or when they first tapped Gulliver, it will be possible to refresh the islands , and three new islands will then appear. The islands are chosen randomly .

All Special Islands In Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp Complete

Here is a chart listing each special island that players can visit and get souvenirs from, what villagers players can expect on that island, and what rewards the player might receive after the ship returns:

item.title: Best Verified Racing Games On The Steam Deck
item.description:
Summary

  • Steam Deck has a growing library of verified games, including big titles like GTA 5 and God of War.
  • Project CARS 3, Lego 2K Drive, and Hot Wheels Unleashed 2 are top racing games approved for the Deck.
  • Dirt 5, Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed, and Forza Horizon 5 offer unique racing experiences for Deck players.

The Steam Deck has a massive library of verified titles right now, and more and more big games are being added to Valve’s verified list each week. The handheld PC is becoming a popular device among gamers, allowing players to boot up and enjoy the likes of Grand Theft Auto 5 , Red Dead Redemption 2 , God of War, and Uncharted: Legacy of Thieves Collection on the go.

Racers have always been popular on handheld devices. Gran Turismo on the PSP was a huge hit, while Nintendo’s Mario Kart 8 Deluxe is the highest-selling game on the Switch. The Steam Deck has a great list of racing games that are well worth trying out on the impressive handheld. Here are the best racers that are verified on the Deck .

Updated January 15, 2025, by Mehrdad Khayyat: Believe it or not, Steam Deck started a new trend on handheld gaming platforms, and it is already the leader of the market when it comes to PC-based gaming experiences.

Relying on Valve's beloved market for games, Steam Deck offers support for a wide variety of games released since its launch. Being Steam Deck Verified has since become an important qualification for games launching on Steam. This badge guarantees that players will not face any issues playing the game on their handheld platform, hardware-wise.

17 Project CARS 3

Detaching From The Origins For An Arcade Approach

Project CARS 3 has no doubt had its critics since it was released into the wild back in August 2020. Many feel that the two previous versions are the better games in the series. The third Project CfARS game changed a lot that made the franchise so successful in the first place, but Project CARS 3 is still an enjoyable racing game.

Having been given the Deck’s green light of approval, Project CARS 3 runs smooth as butter with good graphics. Set to be the final Project CARS game in the series, racing enthusiasts should certainly give it a go on the Steam Deck.

16 Lego 2K Drive

Build Vehicles, Customize Them To The Teeth, And Race!

It's a shame that many racing fans aren't talking about Lego 2K Drive much. Sure, the live-service trappings and the lazy rubber banding of the AI can distract players. However, those who can ignore these issues will realize how much fun it really is to play through an imaginative arcade racer with excellent track design.

Taking shortcuts and bamboozling the opposition makes Lego 2K Drive an underrated racer that more people need to check out. Games like this are a great example of why the live service model shouldn't be slapped onto every game in sight. This label has hurt the long-term interest in this arcade racer quite a bit.

15 Hot Wheels Unleashed 2: Turbocharged

Race At Extreme Speeds With Unique Vehicle Mechanics

Most people were pleasantly surprised to see the wealth of quality on display in Hot Wheels Unleashed . Despite some progression issues, the game's take on toy car racing was a blast. The game's breakneck speeds can even cause these vehicles to fly off the tracks.

So, fans were interested in seeing what Hot Wheels Unleashed 2: Turbocharged brought to the table, and they weren't disappointed. Featuring more moves and better track design than before, the sequel to Hot Wheels Unleashed is a worthy arcade racer. It addresses a lot of issues players had in the first game and adds some interesting elements of its own to keep players engaged.

14 DreamWorks All-Star Kart Racing

When Animation Heroes Take Over The Scene In Action Racing

DreamWorks is a studio that has been through its fair share of ups and downs, but there's no denying that the characters from their movies are iconic. So, the idea of playing a kart racing game featuring many beloved characters from their films is quite engrossing.

DreamWorks All-Star Kart Racing has its fair share of issues, but fans of this studio's work will be able to ignore the vast majority of these problems. The racing is simple and engaging, which is great for players who want to enjoy a title that doesn't feature too many complicated mechanics.

13 Automobilista 2

A Realistic Racing Experience Covering A Wide Variety Of Segments

  • Developer: Reiza Studios
  • Release Date: March 31, 2020
  • Platform: PC

Since its release on Steam in 2020, Automobilista 2 has received good scores from critics and high ratings among players. Earlier in 2022, this solid racing sim, which is also great in Virtual Reality, was given the Steam Deck’s green light of approval, making this a great game to play on handheld devices.

Automobilista 2 is renowned for having excellent graphics, and the frame rate on the Steam Deck can be cranked up to 60fps with few to no issues. Even serious sim racers can enjoy Automobilista 2 on Valve’s impressive handheld system.

12 Inertial Drift

Introducing A Fun New Handling System For Drifters

There aren't many arcade racing games out there, and players will take what they can get at this point. However, it's not necessary to lower one's standards to check out such a racing game. Inertial Drift completely changes the mechanics of how a race works to make for a truly breathtaking time.

Using two analog sticks to control a car in a race was simply unheard of before this title came into the fray. More racing fans need to check out Inertial Drift and understand what makes it such a special indie gem and the Steam Deck is a great platform to let this game shine.

11 Dirt 5

An Arcade Approach To Circuit-Based Rally Races

When the Steam Deck became available to order, Dirt 5 was added to its verified list right away. This arcade racer is unique and is not for everyone, but the tracks and the cars look stunning. The Dirt 5 entry into the Dirt franchise is a lot of fun to play and will provide endless hours of thrills and spills.

Dirt 5 stepped away from the usual simulation of rally driving, making this version a pick-up-and-play type of game for players new to the genre. There are a whole host of verified racers to play on the Steam Deck, and Dirt 5 should be right at the top of the list.

10 Euro Truck Simulator 2

The Ultimate Trucker Experience With A Massive Open World

While not a racing game per se, Euro Truck Simulator 2 has one of the most realistic driving models in any title. The aim of the game is to be methodical and take things so, taking the edge off for players as they course through urban landscapes, green countrysides, and anything else along the same lines.

The game may not seem all that interesting at first glance, but players even remotely interested should jump in and give this title a shot. If the experience clicks with them, then they'll be completely glued to their screens as the hours fly by!

9 F1 22

A Racing Experience For Dedicated Competitive Players

Although F1 24 is already out, the latest game in the franchise that is verified for Steam Deck is F1 22 , which is another extremely solid entry in Codemaster’s Formula One franchise. It is a gorgeous game, with cars and circuits that look as close to real life as fans have ever seen before. F1 22 added F1 Life mode and the ability to crossplay in the multiplayer section.

We have seen F1 titles on handhelds before, but never as polished as F1 22 . Players can enjoy this excellent racing game at 60fps with good graphics. Lower the frame rate and F1 fans will get an even better experience. This terrific racer is well worth owning on the Deck.

8 Asphalt Legends Unite

A Free Arcade Racing With Lightning Fast Speeds

What makes Asphalt Legends Unite stand out from all the other games listed here is the fact that it is free-to-play. The game is a massive visual leap over the mobile-only Asphalt entries, and it comes with a huge number of cars that can be purchased with in-game progress.

The game focuses on circuit-based races rather than being an open world, but the multiplayer section is quite fun and challenging, as players try to win and rank up. However, keep in mind that the monetization model does include some pay-to-win elements, which allows some players to upgrade their vehicles earlier than others.

7 Old School Rally

Revisiting Retro Rally Sims With Modern Gameplay Mechanics

  • Developer: Frozen Lake Games
  • Release Date: July 18, 2024 (Early Access)
  • Platform: PC

Ever missed the good old days of playing Colin McRae Rally ? Well, Old School Rally just delivers the same experience with modern-day controls and progression.

Developed by a small indie team, Old School Rally is an arcade-style rally experience with retro PlayStation 1 visuals. The game absolutely nails it by creating a nostalgic experience to take the players back to their childhood but bear in mind that it is still in Early Access.

The driving mechanics are not supposed to be accurate like a simulator, so make sure to come in with maintained expectations. The variety of cars isn't eye-catching, but they mostly include the vehicles that belong to older periods of rally, and the same goes for the tracks. The quantity for both of them, however, will increase upon full release.

6 Trials Fusion

Race Against Time In An Unusual Circuit For Dedicated Bikers

Players who want to go through a goofy racing game with platforming elements will have a great time playing through Trials Fusion . This amazing series has churned out hit after hit, and Fusion is no exception to this golden rule. There are so many tracks — both in-game and fan-made — that players can spend hours without any problems.

The crashes can be pretty wacky and cause people to burst into fits of laughter, and the online multiplayer is the icing on top of this loaded cake. Trials Fusion is an excellent and simple game that is easy to get into, and players will love what's in store here!

5 Wreckfest

Chaotic Racing Experience With Phenomenal Car Physics

Wreckfest is a unique racing game, which focuses more on smashing up the player's opponent’s car than traditional wheel-to-wheel racing. It’s still a solid racer in its own right, but destruction derbies and no-rules racing are where Wreckfest really shines.

A Switch version of Wreckfest was recently released, but the Steam Deck is the handheld king for this game. Players can play Wreckfest on high settings and at 60fps and have a great time doing so.

4 Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed Collection

A Timeless Racing Experience With Beloved Characters And Challenging Tracks

Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed Collection is a blast to play on the Steam Deck. Thanks to its verified tag, this racer can be enjoyed at a high frame rate and great graphics, too. The original version was released back in 2012 on the PS3, Xbox 360, Wii U, and PC. There were also handheld versions on the PS Vita, Nintendo 3DS, and mobile.

Sonic & All-Stars Racing Transformed has been on handheld devices for years, but the Steam Deck version takes it to an entirely new level. The graphics are stellar, and the gameplay remains as thrilling as ever. For Sonic racing fun on the go, add this to the Steam Deck library.

3 Lonely Mountains: Downhill

An Extremely Challenging Mountain Bike Adventure

For anyone looking to challenge themselves in a race against time, Lonely Mountains: Downhill is a must-buy. The game comes with beautiful but simple visuals, and it's only a race against time, but the real challenge is about learning the tracks.

Each track offers a unique experience, where players not only need to find the correct path but also should discover the shortcuts to submit better records. This game is more like a Dark-Souls -gone-racing experience, as it requires a lot of trials and errors to find the best place to pedal and the best place to brake at each part of the track, but every failure does teach something new to the player.

2 Crazy Taxi

An All-Time Classic Open-World Driving Experience

Crazy Taxi is one of the best arcade racing series around. Many players have fond memories of drifting and jumping around Sega's patented franchise. The fact that players can check this title out on the go is a great example of how far gaming has come, with the port of this title optimized for the Steam Deck.

1 Forza Horizon 5

Arguably The Best Open-World Arcade Racing With Insane Visual Quality

Forza Horizon 5 enjoyed an amazing launch. The vast open world and the boundless map allowed for ample moments where racers could go all out on the track and utilize a bevy of vehicles to beat the opposition. While the progression present in this game is questionable at best, most players don't mind since they can zoom through the world in record time if they get lucky with a wheelspin!

The game's rendition of Mexico is beautiful, and the Horizon Events are the most memorable part of the package by far. While the story is threadbare and does nothing to justify its inclusion, players who just want to experience an excellent racing game without any caveats will love what Forza Horizon 5 brings to the table.

That being said, a lot of this game is censored because of the rights expiring for it. As a result, players should check out the many mods available for this game so that they can enjoy the definitive experience without too many issues.

item.title: 7 Open-World Games With The Most Emotional Side Stories, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • In the open-world genre, side stories often serve as a treasure trove of emotional depth and personal impact.
  • Games like Kingdom Come: Deliverance and Red Dead Redemption 2 offer grounded worlds filled with believable characters and relatable, complex dramas.
  • State of Decay 2 and Middle-Earth: Shadow of War leverage unique sandbox mechanics to generate personal and emotional gameplay stories beyond pre-designed quests.

Aside from the main story, open-world games offer a wide range of activities that can be genuinely rewarding for players. In many titles, side quests tend to be functional but forgettable, like simple tasks often worth completing only for rewards or XP. However, some games truly shine by delivering optional quests with engaging and emotional stories.

From side quests featuring heart-wrenching and tragic plot twists to narratives centered around memorable characters with vibrant personalities, and even unique sandbox systems that create deeply personal gaming moments beyond any quest, here are some of the best open-world games celebrated for their emotional storytelling.

Although open-world RPGs such as The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt , Cyberpunk 2077 , Elden Ring , NieR: Automata , and Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth are known for some of the most emotional side content, they won't be included below as they have already been featured in a similar list focusing on emotional RPG side stories.

7 Ghost Of Tsushima

Moving Optional Storylines That Explore The Complicated Fates Of Jin's Allies

Ghost of Tsushima features numerous side quests, most of which focus on liberating the people of Tsushima from the Mongol invasion. While these smaller stories often include tragic or emotional twists, they aren't as memorable or impactful as the side stories involving Jin Sakai's allies and companions. Characters like Yuna, Taka, Lady Masako, Sensei Ishikawa, warrior-monk Norio, mercenary Ryuzo, and others take center stage in these richer dramatic narratives.

The full arcs of these characters unfold over multiple quests, delving into their complex stories of past mistakes, revenge, acceptance, betrayal, and more. By focusing on a smaller group of characters across several interconnected quests, the developers create intricate tales and believable personalities that deeply resonate with players as they progress through each storyline.

6 State Of Decay 2

Sandbox Survival Mechanics And Permadeath Allow For Emotional And Personal Moments

State of Decay 2 strikes a balance between narrative elements and sandbox survival mechanics, allowing players to control various characters with unique traits, switching between them as needed. While the game offers fewer traditional side quests compared to other open-world titles, often limited to formulaic "Survivors in Need" missions involving rescuing people from zombies, its survival mechanics can generate personal, emergent stories through gameplay. These moments often feel more impactful than the pre-designed quests found in other games.

One of the game's standout features is permadeath for every playable character. This means players can permanently lose their favorite characters based on their actions. Such unpredictable losses hit hard, leaving a lasting impression that surpasses the emotional weight of side quests involving random characters.

5 Kingdom Come: Deliverance

A Grounded Medieval World Full Of Emotional And Relatable Stories With Great Variety

With Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 on the horizon, the original game remains a standout medieval open-world experience, packed with engaging and emotional moments, tough challenges, and immersive day-to-day activities. Featuring over 50 side quests with impressive variety, Kingdom Come: Deliverance players can explore stories that often include unpredictable twists, ranging from amusing and lighthearted to tragic and deeply moving. Some quests even shift tone entirely as they progress, keeping players on their toes.

The grounded nature of the game's world and characters is perhaps its greatest appeal. Centered on relatable subjects and the everyday concerns of common folk, it vividly reflects the dramatic hardships and challenges ordinary people faced during that era.

4 Middle-Earth: Shadow Of War

The Nemesis System Provides Unforgettable And Personal Character Interactions

Similar to State of Decay 2, the strengths of Middle-earth: Shadow of War don't lie in its side quests but in its innovative sandbox gameplay. Powered by the groundbreaking Nemesis system, Shadow of War creates unpredictable and emotional personal narratives based on players' interactions with orc NPCs, leading to unforgettable alliances, dramatic betrayals, and fierce rivalries between the protagonist and these custom characters.

Every encounter with orc chieftains can result in vastly different outcomes depending on the players' choices: whether they choose to kill them, spare them, or recruit them into their army. It's a system brimming with potential for exciting and memorable storytelling. If only Warner Bros. hadn't patented this groundbreaking feature, allowing more games to benefit from its incredible narrative possibilities.

3 Red Dead Redemption 2

The Unparalleled Interactivity Of The World And Its People

In many ways, Red Dead Redemption 2 mirrors Kingdom Come: Deliverance in its approach to creating a grounded and believable open world. Set in the Wild West, it's filled with stories and tragedies that span a wide range of moods and emotions, reflecting the unpredictability of life itself. From side quests to random encounters with strangers, RDR 2 keeps players constantly engaged with its NPCs — arguably the most convincing and reactive characters ever created in an open-world genre.

Beyond its countless pre-designed stories, Red Dead Redemption 2 excels at generating random events with unpredictable outcomes that can catch players completely off guard. For example, losing a favorite horse due to a simple navigation error can be a deeply personal and emotional experience, surpassing the impact of many side stories in other games.

2 The Forgotten City

A Unique Narrative-Driven World Of Ancient Rome Fully Dependent On Players' Choices

Originally a Skyrim mod, The Forgotten City stands out as one of the most unique narrative-driven open-world games, with a strong focus on dialogue and player choices. Perfect for those who prefer to resolve conflicts through wit rather than violence, the game features a cast of intriguing characters and their dramatic side stories (referred to as leads), offering players a flexible approach to solving them.

While The Forgotten City has far fewer side quests compared to most triple-A open-world titles, each one is packed with complex dilemmas and dual-layered narratives. These quests challenge players emotionally, presenting difficult choices with significant consequences for the characters involved. For anyone seeking a truly emotional and thought-provoking open-world experience, The Forgotten City is not to be missed.

1 Fallout: New Vegas

A Profound And Emotional RPG Experience Set In A Fascinating Universe

Years after its release, Fallout: New Vegas remains a pinnacle of the franchise, celebrated for its vast array of side quests, unparalleled player freedom, impactful decisions, and unpredictable twists. Often hailed as the best Fallout game and Obsidian's crowning achievement, the journey through the Mojave and the city of New Vegas is an emotional rollercoaster filled with vibrant personalities, diverse factions, and greatly written companions, delivering some of the most creative side stories in the RPG genre.

The true strength of Fallout: New Vegas lies in its rare ability to let players fully roleplay as fleshed-out characters, leading to unforgettable resolutions when players stay true to their chosen archetypes. Each playthrough offers countless surprises, previously inaccessible quests shaped by choices and alliances, and dozens of unique and emotionally charged character interactions.
